messages: 0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (11:07): waita  minute. 4d35062a3f311c4cc30e53243a56f018 (11:53): Hi, I have a basic question. I installed Sol10 (x86) and when OS starts, I cannot see dtlogin because it's any problem with my screen. Is it possible to disabled graphic environtment, pleaseø?

4d35062a3f311c4cc30e53243a56f018 (11:55): jamesd_ but I cannot use ssh or rlogin and I only have root user. :-(
7691fd5e5ce7ea1a5463d060fce1dcf3 (11:56): boot into single usermode, i think its add  -s  to  the second line in the grub config
7691fd5e5ce7ea1a5463d060fce1dcf3 (11:58): then google how to start it via signle usermode... i forgot i haven't booted x86 into single usermode in a long time

4d35062a3f311c4cc30e53243a56f018 (12:01): but my keyboard is in English

0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (12:19): or is this a PC 101 keyboard ?   /usr/share/lib/keytables/type_101/spain

0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (12:24): you mean to do patch management?
e55e49dbdc0b3b324ddec7711f265523 (12:24): by upgrade you mean from u1 to u2 ? or patch ?
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (12:24): err, smpatch may have been sol9
e55e49dbdc0b3b324ddec7711f265523 (12:24): pca works on all solaris ;p
e55e49dbdc0b3b324ddec7711f265523 (12:25): it's just a frontend to wget/patchadd/patchrm
e55e49dbdc0b3b324ddec7711f265523 (12:25): but it works very good

0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (12:26): i found smpatch a bit erratic.  last time I used it, I had to do a `smpatch analyze >patchlist, then `smpatch download <patchlist`, then reboot to -s and smpatch add <patchlist
e55e49dbdc0b3b324ddec7711f265523 (12:26): it's a presentation of PCA
4d35062a3f311c4cc30e53243a56f018 (12:27): Do you know what's the problem ,please?
e55e49dbdc0b3b324ddec7711f265523 (12:27): it's not an official Sun tool
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (12:29): um, the `set` command takes stuff like patchpro.install.types=standard:singleuser:reconfigafter:rebootafter
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (12:29): -H is a parameter to any command.
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (12:29): `smpatch get` to see what parameters can be set.
4d35062a3f311c4cc30e53243a56f018 (12:30): This command requires PatchPro, but PatchPro is not installed.
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (12:30): ah, then you need to install patchpro.
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (12:30): which is a optional package or set of packages.
4d35062a3f311c4cc30e53243a56f018 (12:30): do you know which package is ?
f125bffc1f0a1a40b303ba28b18f0062 (12:31): how can you get a list of all the available svcadm patterns? i'm trying to shutdown stuff like snmp but network/snmp:default just isn't enough
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (12:33): my cheatsheet on svc manager also lists these as handy.
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (12:33): svcs -l network/login ñ list service status
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (12:33): svcadm enable network/login:rlogin ñ enable a specific service
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (12:33): svcadm disable ... ñ disable a service
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (12:33): svcadm restart svc:/network/login:rlogin ñ restart a specific service
f125bffc1f0a1a40b303ba28b18f0062 (12:34): oh and while i'm here, what is loghost? is it something i'm supposed to set in /etc/hosts? my syslog complains about not being able to resolve loghost
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (12:35): then add it to your localhost line
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (12:35): err, to your named host line, I guess.
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (12:35): thats the default setup on one of my suns...
f125bffc1f0a1a40b303ba28b18f0062 (12:36): mine uses dhcp so i think it rewrites the last line every time it gets a new ip-address
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (12:36): do you have a designated site logging ysstem?  you can set it to that.
f125bffc1f0a1a40b303ba28b18f0062 (12:36): i don't know what that is
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (12:37): that would be a server at a static address thats doing syslogging for the whole network.
f125bffc1f0a1a40b303ba28b18f0062 (12:37): no this is just a personal laptop
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (12:37): otherwise, put it on the localhost line.
